meanings.definition: A wooden pin or peg used to reinforce a joint.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter inserted a dowel into the furniture joint.
meanings.sent2: She carefully hammered the dowel into place to secure the shelf.
meanings.sent3: Why did the dowel refuse to join the party? It was feeling a bit wooden!
meanings.sent4: The dowel was like a tiny soldier, standing strong in the wooden fortress of the chair.
meanings.sent5: The dowel, a small but mighty wooden peg, held the entire structure together.

meanings.definition: To fasten or strengthen with a dowel.
meanings.sent1: He decided to dowel the pieces of wood together for extra support.
meanings.sent2: You can dowel the bookshelf to make it more stable.
meanings.sent3: Why did the table go to school? To learn how to dowel better!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a dowel, firmly securing her goals in place.
meanings.sent5: The carpenter carefully dowelled the chair legs to prevent wobbling.

meanings.definition: A cylindrical rod used as a support or axis.
meanings.sent1: The dowel served as a sturdy support for the rotating mechanism.
meanings.sent2: The curtain rod was actually a metal dowel disguised with fabric.
meanings.sent3: Why did the dowel feel dizzy? It had been spinning around all day!
meanings.sent4: The dowel was the unsung hero, silently holding everything together.
meanings.sent5: The dowel, a simple rod, was the backbone of the entire structure.
